title: White Phosphorous Matches Prohibition Act, 1913
description: Official consolidated text of White Phosphorous Matches Prohibition Act, 1913 (V of 1913) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title, extent and commencement
provisions.content:
(1) This Act may be called the White
Phosphorus Matches Prohibition Act, 1913.
2
[(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan.]
(3) It shall come into force on the first day of July, 1913, with the exception of section 6,
which shall come into force on the first day of July, 1914.

provisions.title: Section 3. [Prohibition of importation by addition to section 18, Act VIII of 1878.] Rep. by the
provisions.content: Repealing Act, 1938 (I of 1938), s. 2 and Schedule.

provisions.title: Section 4. Prohibition of use of white phosphorous in manufacture of matches
provisions.content:
(1) No person
shall use white phosphorus in the manufacture of matches.
(2) Any person who uses, or permits the use by any person under his control, of white
phosphorus in the manufacture of matches, shall be punishable with fine which may extend to two
hundred rupees.

provisions.title: Section 5. Power of Inspector of Factories to take samples of material used in manufacture
provisions.content:
(1)
Every person who manufactures matches shall allow an Inspector of Factories appointed under the
3
[Factories Act, 1934] , at any time to take for analysis sufficient samples of any material in use or
mixed for use, in such manufacture:
Provided that any such person may, at the time the sample is taken, and on providing the
necessary appliances, require the Inspector to divide the sample so taken into two parts, and to mark,
seal and deliver to him one part.
(2) Any person who refuses to permit any such Inspector of Factories as aforesaid to take a
sample, in accordance with the provisions of sub-section (1), shall be punishable with fine which
may extend to two hundred rupees.
1
For Statement of Objects and Reasons, see Gazette of India, 1912, Pt. V, p. 220 ; for Report of Select Committee, see ibid., 1913, Pt. V, p. 35; and for
Proceedings in Council, see, ibid., 1913, Pt. VI, pp. 16, 64 and 146.
This Act has been declared to be in force in Baluchistan by the British Baluchistan Laws Regulation, 1913 (2 of 1913), s. 3.
It has also been extended to the Leased Areas of Baluchistan, see the Leased Areas (Laws) Order, 1950 (G. G. O. 3 of 1950); and applied to the
Federated Areas of Baluchistan, see Gazette of India, 1937, Pt. I. p. 1499.
This Act has been amended to the extent of Islamabad Capital Territory, see ordinance No. 27 of 1981, s. 5 and 4th Sch.

provisions.title: Section 6. Prohibition of sale
provisions.content:
(1) No person shall sell, or offer or expose for sale, or have in his
possession for the purposes of sale, any matches made with white phosphorus.
(2) Any person who contravenes the provisions of sub-section (1) may, on complaint to a 1[*
2
*], Magistrate of the first class, be ordered to forfeit any such matches in his possession, and any
matches so forfeited shall be destroyed or otherwise dealt with as the Magistrate may direct.
